title: How to Add a Website Link to the Start Menu

steps.title: Open the web browser of your choice.
steps.content: Open the web browser of your choice. Type the URL address of the web site you want to turn into a shortcut into the text box located at the top of your browser.

steps.title: Click the website's favicon.
steps.content: Click the website's favicon. A “favicon” is always located to the left of your website's URL address. By default, a website's favicon will be a page. If a website is secure, the website's favicon will be a lock. Once your page has loaded, click and hold the left mouse button on this icon.

steps.title: Drag and drop the favicon from the URL bar to your desktop.
steps.content: Drag and drop the favicon from the URL bar to your desktop. This will create a shortcut with the web page's title as the name.

steps.title: Right-click the newly created shortcut and select Copy.
steps.content: Right-click the newly created shortcut and select Copy. This will save your shortcut to your computer's clipboard and will allow you to paste a new version of this shortcut wherever you need it.

steps.title: Open the Programs folder.
steps.content: Open the Programs folder. You will see a long list of icons. These are the programs that are currently on your computer. Press the Windows key and “R” at the same time (Win+R). In the new window, type 'shell:programs'. Hit “Enter”.

steps.title: Right-click in the opened folder.
steps.content: Right-click in the opened folder. Select “Paste” from the drop down menu. This will install your new shortcut into the Programs folder.

steps.title: On the Start Menu, locate the new shortcut.
steps.content: On the Start Menu, locate the new shortcut. Open the Start Menu at the bottom of your screen and select All Apps to see your new shortcut.

steps.title: Drag and drop your icon into the Start Screen.
steps.content: Drag and drop your icon into the Start Screen. Dragging and dropping your shortcut to the Start Screen will help it be more visible. Click and hold your shortcut. Drag it over to the tiled screen and place it wherever you'd like.

steps.title: Finished!
steps.content: Finished! You'll now be able to see your new shortcut in both the Start Menu and the Start screen.

steps.title: Open the web browser of your choice.
steps.content: Open the web browser of your choice. Select a browser that you use often and are familiar with.

steps.title: Open your desired web page.
steps.content: Open your desired web page. In the web page address box, copy the entire selection starting from http:// to the end of the line. Use “Ctrl+C” or right click on the highlighted text and select “Copy” from the menu.

steps.title: Create your shortcut on the Desktop.
steps.content: Create your shortcut on the Desktop. Right click the Desktop. In the new menu, hover over “New”. Select “Shortcut” from the second dropdown menu.

steps.title: Paste the copied URL into the textbox.
steps.content: Paste the copied URL into the textbox. Paste the URL you copied from your browser into the text box under “Type the location of the item”.

steps.title: Name your shortcut.
steps.content: Name your shortcut. Give your shortcut an appropriate name so that you can easily find it in the future.

steps.title: Click Finish.
steps.content: Click Finish. Your Shortcut will now appear on the desktop.

steps.title: Right click the icon.
steps.content: Right click the icon. Select “Pin to Start” in the drop down menu. Pin to Start will attach your shortcut to the Start Menu.

steps.title: Click the Start Menu.
steps.content: Click the Start Menu. You can find your new shortcut in this menu and can now be used as desired.

steps.title: Open the web browser of your choice.
steps.content: Open the web browser of your choice. From there, open the web page you want and copy the text in the URL box. Right click this box and select “Copy” in the drop down menu or use the shortcut Ctrl+C.

steps.title: Right click on the start button and select "Explore".
steps.content: Right click on the start button and select "Explore". By clicking “Explore”, a window for the Start Menu will open up.

steps.title: Create a new shortcut.
steps.content: Create a new shortcut. This is where you'll enter the URL you wish to use as a shortcut. Right click in the Explorer window. In the menu that appears, hover over “New”. Select "Shortcut" from the secondary menu.

steps.title: Enter the desired URL into the text box.
steps.content: Enter the desired URL into the text box. A dialogue box to create your shortcut will open. Click the text box under 'Type the location of item'. Paste the URL you copied earlier into this box. Press “Next”.

steps.title: Give your shortcut a unique name.
steps.content: Give your shortcut a unique name. Use an appropriate name that will help you easily identify your shortcut.

steps.title: Click "Finish".
steps.content: Click "Finish". This will close the Shortcut dialogue menu and bring you back to your Desktop.

steps.title: You're done!
steps.content: You're done! Now when you open the Start Menu, the URL shortcut should be there.
